title: Ticket #875: DAGMan should support 'heredocs' for job submit files
description:
Dagman should support a 'heredoc' syntax to make certain types of autogeneration of dagfiles easier to do. The heredoc would be the contents of the submit file. 

JOB JobName SubmitDescriptionFileName [DIR directory] [DONE]<<END
# The lines of the submit file.
universe = scheduler
executable = /bin/true
notification = Never
output = $NAME.out
error = $NAME.err
# no log file means use the default log
END

# later in the dag file:
VARS JobName "$NAME=$JOB"

When dagman encounters this job, it will write a temporary submit file, then submit it. This will preserve the ability of VARS interpolants to work.

The SubmitDescriptionFileName would either have to be a known keyword, or left out and the parser figures out that DIR wasn't the job name, but the directory directive if the << was found. There probably needs to be more thought on the syntax of the JOB directive to make it parser friendly.

If we decided to add whole dag variables, then we'd have to reason about the name spaces of the dag variables versus the VARS variables in terms of the submit file. I believe we'd have to do this any way even in the case of a non-heredoc job, but I mention it here so it isn't forgotten.
